title: Nightly compiler crash on Type substitution.

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: E-needs-mcve
labels.description: Call for participation: This issue needs a Minimal Complete and Verifiable Example

body:
I am following along Philip Opperman blog and was on the [third post[(https://os.phil-opp.com/testing/) about testing. I was able to figure out that if I commented out the following test_case then it would no longer crash. The full code that I was using can be found [here](https://github.com/oldwomanjosiah/blog-os-follow/tree/eeeee62f57a301bbf6eaadacd89587e852e2aebf) if that would help. ### Code Test that was causing the issue: ```Rust #[test_case] fn print_to_screen() { let to_screen = "Prints to Screen"; println!("{}", to_screen); let buffer = WRITER.lock(); for (i, c) in to_screen.chars().enumerate() { assert_eq!( char::from((buffer.chars[BUFFER_HEIGHT - 2][i]).read().ascii_char), c ); } } ``` Version of test harness where `core::any::type_name` was called: ```rust #[cfg(test)] fn test_runner(tests: &[&dyn Testable]) { println_serial!("[ ]: Running {} Tests", tests.len()); for test in tests { println_serial!(); test.run(); } println_serial!("\n[ ]: All Tests passed"); exit_qemu(QemuExitCode::Success); } pub trait Testable { fn run(&self) -> (); } impl Testable for T where T: Fn() -> () { fn run(&self) -> () { println_serial!("[ TEST ]: {}", core::any::type_name::()); self(); println_serial!("[ OK ]"); } } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.51.0-nightly (368275062 2021-02-02) binary: rustc commit-hash: 368275062fb655c1f36e0398f88b15379a1f3c93 commit-date: 2021-02-02 host: x86_64-apple-darwin release: 1.51.0-nightly LLVM version: 11.0.1 ``` ### Error output Before backtrace: ``` error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_middle/src/ty/subst.rs:516:17: expected type for `T/#0` (T/0) but found Lifetime('_#77r) when substituting, substs=['_#77r, vga_buffer::Writer] ``` After Backtrace: ``` query stack during panic: #0 [typeck] type-checking `vga_buffer::tests::print_to_screen` #1 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies #2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate end of query stack ```
